aas:langStringTextType.aas:text: Information on the classified load spectrum including kind of classificationen, Classes, Limits
Full information on loadchannel including name, unit, limits, classes
Full information on loadchannel including name, unit, limits, classes
In case of non- equidistant classes, the limits of the intervalls are given here. Optional, but if given, this list will be used. List must start with lowerLimit and end with upperLimit.
Body contains the data lists of load channel classes and the corresponding countings.
Several load channel classes are sorted in a list. For rainflow counting, a load channel has two channel class lists, from-class and to-class.
Each channel class list are identified by the name and contains the list of classes describing the load.
The class list contains the classes describing the load. The loading is the combination of all load channel classes, therefore, duplicates are possible.
List of counts according to the load channel lists.
List of counts according to the load channel lists.
All information decribing the source, purpose and application of the load spectrum.
Status describes the date when this aspect is filled, the according mileage and according operating time.
Rainflow counting is restricted to one channel. Unclosed hystereses are described as list of classes.
List of load-classes not defining a closed hysterese.

aas:langStringDefinitionTypeIec61360.aas:text: load spectrum with classified loads
identifier of the load channel, needed to combine the loading with the damage calculation
unit of the corresponding load channel
for classification, a range of load values must be set. The limits and the number of bins decribe the classes.
for classification, a range of load values must be set. The limits and the number of bins decribe the classes.
for classification, a range of load values must be set. The limits and the number of bins decribe the classes.
In case of non- equidistant classes, the limits of the intervalls are given here. Optional, but if given, this list will be used. List must start with lowerLimit and end with upperLimit.
Full information on loadchannel including name, unit, limits, classes
Type of classification: rainflow or event counting or load revolution distribution
Optional. By default, the number of for example events or peaks are counted. Value should be given if for example time or revolutions are counted.
depending on counted value: if revolutions are counted, counted unit might be 1/min or 1/s. Required, default is "/", which means no unit.
Information on the classified load spectrum including kind of classification, Classes, Limits
The class list contains the classes describing the load. The loading is the combination of all load channel classes, therefore, duplicates are possible.
Channel name extended by "-class". In case of rainflow counting, the extention is from-class and to-class.
Several load channel classes are sorted in a list. For rainflow counting, a load channel has two channel class lists, from-class and to-class.
Name of the counted value: "Counts" or "Time" or" Revolutions"
List of counts according to the load channel lists.
List of counts according to the load channel lists.
List of load channel classes and corresponding counts

Component or assembly the load spectrum is valid for. A ZF_lrd counted load spectrum belomgs to a gear set while a temperature load spectrum belong to the part where the temperature is measured (gear oil or IGBT).
Information on the route which the load spectrum is representing. For example "city munich heavy trailer" or "motorway light trailer agil driver".
Further information on the vehicle /assembly/component.
Mileage of the vehicle respectively part.
date representing the load spectrum
Operating hours covered by the load spectrum.
Identification of vehicle status
all information describing the source, purpose and application of the load spectrum.
CX-ID /AAS-ID des Zwilling
Name of the load channel extended by -class
List of load-classes not defining a closed hysterese.
Residuum of load history i case of rainflow counting
